item.title: Gl54 4hq, 14th January
item.description:
I have reported Capel lane before without any correspondence back. Date reported was 5 July 25. There are now 32 pot holes of which I have taken photos. Exactly location I am reporting is the lane between Redwood house and Capel orchard. Capel lane. This is also right of way to the CW

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Capel Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Roughly 12inches diameter and depth of 20 plus cms deep, 14th January
item.description:
Huge pot hole which is very deep on busy road with buses I broke a road spring costing £270 driving through this as it was dark and could not be seen health and safety of everyone not being considered pothole not painted either it has been present for the last 10 days that I am aware of
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 158, Innsworth Lane, Innsworth, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

All along the lane to the sides of the road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Frog Furlong Lane, Innsworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: Uneven paving slabs, 14th January
item.description:
Paving is uneven on Farmington Road and surrounding roads. I regularly trip on it and stubbing my foot on uneven paving slabs has caused 2 pairs of shoes to tear at the front. I have dyspraxia and I struggle anyway with my coordination, having accessible roads and pavements should be a priority for the council. There’s an elderly woman who I have seen walking in the road on a number of occasions. The rest of the road is tarmac. Please fix this.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, Farmington Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Annoying plastic road barriers left since Oct 2025 - please remove, 14th January
item.description:
These annoying plastic road barriers are all the way down Rose & Crown Passage which is a very narrow road anyway. They have fallen over and all of the residents who live and park their vehicles in parking spaces on the road would PLEASE like them removing as soon as possible. They were put up in October 2025 and nothing has been done since. Thank you so much

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): North Place, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing curved mirror, 14th January
item.description:
There is a missing curved mirror opposite the exit from the James Hopkins Trust. This causes he exit to be dangerous for vehicles to leave due to a blind spot where vehicles on the main road cannot be seen by vehicles leaving. This is likely to cause a collision.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): North Upton Lane, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
